com.github.basking2.sdsai.dsds.node.tx

Class Operation<KEY,VALUE>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.basking2.sdsai.dsds.node.tx.Operation<KEY,VALUE>
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    CachedReadOperation

    public abstract class Operation<KEY,VALUE>
extends java.lang.Object
    An Operation is write, read, or other activity on a NodeStore which is included in a TransactionalNodeStore.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Operation()
      Create a new operation with key and value set to null.
      Operation(KEY key, VALUE value)
      Create a new operation with key and value set to the given parameters.

    • Method Detail

      • getValue

        public VALUE getValue()
        Return the value of this operation if it is successful. The null value is appropriate if this is a write operation where there is no data returned.
        Returns:
        VALUE of operation or null.

      • getKey

        public KEY getKey()
        Return a unique identifier that allows for tracking of this operation.

      • delete

        public void delete()
        Delete this operation. An operation structure typically has a lot of data associated with it. When a future operation obviates a previous operation that previous operation is not removed from the TransactionalNodeStore structure. Rather, its delete() method is called to release all unecessary data and mark the Operation as deleted. Deleted operations will not be executed when the TransactionalNodeStore is committed.

      • isDeleted

        public boolean isDeleted()
        Return if this operation is deleted.

      • execute

        public void execute()
        Execute this operation if delete() has not been called on it.
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - or other unchecked exceptions to communicate failure.

      • doExecute

        protected abstract void doExecute()
        Implementing classes should implement this method. This is conditionally called by execute() if delete() has not been previously called.
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - or other unchecked exceptions to communicate failure.
